column5: I'm not sure if this is the right forum to post this but I'll give it a shot. I'd like to take my 13 year old grandson on a great fishing vacation in Canada. No group, just my grandson and I. I'm looking for a cabin, drive to or fly/boat in. I'll take my own boat if it's a drive to location. Trophy fish is not the goal, just good numbers of walleye, perch, pike, or smallmouth bass. I live in Michigan so a location within 250km or so from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario or would be great. If anyone has any places they could recomend it would be much appreciated. Thanks.
They have lots of new boats and you will catch a ton of Walleye, my 12 year old son caught at least 50 Walleye last year. Check out their website.
O'Sullivan's Rainbow near Nakina. www.osullivansrainbow.com Bill
LOOK AT WWW.RAYSCAMPS.COM 2 HOUR BARGE RIDE AND GOOD FISHING FOR PIKE AND WALLEYE A FEW PERCH. PM ME IF YOU WANT MORE INFO
Check out Brennan Harbour Resort in Spanish, Ontario...great fishing and great facilities. www.brennanharbour.com.
Went to Ellen Island Camp three years ago, 2 hours north of North Bay, boat in, good fishing, great spot, nice cabins and great boats. www.ellenislandcamp.com

Nanuk, can you or anyone else please expand upon the fishing at Ellen Island Camp ... or any of the other spots mentioned in this thread. I've been reading the posts on this site for about a year now and very little information is posted about places east of Lake Superior. I've checked out the websites that you folks have been nice enough to link, but a lodge's website certainly does not tell the whole story.Thanks as always.

Where do you live in Michigan? I am in the Dowagiac area. I recommend you look at www.fishthefinest.com site for Pine Portage Lodge. It is a flyin from Wawa. We have gone there several times. You can pick the number of days you want, not the standard saturday to saturday. It is more expensive, around $1,000 per person just for the camp, for 4 days. I would get a guide. They do everything. I spend the summers in Canada fishing over in the NW part of Ontario and I still go on the trip to "Kaby" with a group. Would be glad to tell you more, if you want to contact me. I really believe this is one of the best ways to introduce your grandson to canada fishing.
